sales_service.sales_app module

class sales_service.sales_app.Sale(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a sales transaction.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Unique identifier for the sale (primary key)

  • username (str) – Username of the customer who made the purchase

  • product_name (str) – Name of the product purchased

  • quantity (int) – Quantity of the product purchased

  • total_price (float) – Total price of the sale

  • timestamp (datetime) – Timestamp when the sale was made

id
product_name
quantity
query: t.ClassVar[Query]

A SQLAlchemy query for a model. Equivalent to db.session.query(Model). Can be customized per-model by overriding query_class.

Warning

The query interface is considered legacy in SQLAlchemy. Prefer using session.execute(select()) instead.

sales_service.sales_app.display_available_products()[source]

Displays all available products with stock greater than zero.

Returns:

JSON response with product details

Return type:

flask.Response

sales_service.sales_app.get_product_details(product_name)[source]

Returns:

sales_service.sales_app.make_sale()[source]

Processes a sale by deducting stock, updating the customer’s wallet balance, and recording the sale.

Returns:

JSON response with sale details or error message

Return type:

flask.Response
